intro: Dortmanna ghiesbreghtii, commonly known as the Ghiesbreght's dock, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears small, greenish flowers. Native to the wetlands and marshes of southern Europe, it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
